messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2583
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/30/02 1:39:57 PM, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/30/02 1:39:57 PM, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
writes:

<< wow!that sounds great!we'd love to do things like that but we don't have
a farm or know anybody with animals.maybe that's why unschooling would be
harder for me.>>

Well, if that were true I'd be in big trouble since I'm in the middle of
Chicago!


<last night the girls & i were putting sea salt on each others feet & inside
the jar was a seashell & they wanted to know all about them,so i said we'd
got to the library to get books on them,but if i could go to a beach & they
could see seashells,i think they would learn much more than from a book.>

Probably some day they will go to the beach. It doesn't have to be an
immediate connection to be of use. There's all kinds of learning, some is
hands-on, some comes from books - it's all good.

Paula
